intro: Xanthostemon verus, commonly known as the yellow myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and birds. Xanthostemon verus is well adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and dry woodland habitats.
